intro: Sisymbrium nasturtiifolium, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a hairy stem with alternate leaves. Its seeds are small and contain high levels of erucic acid, making them useful in certain industrial applications. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
